Pre-Game Insights: India are deriving the joys of having a fully-fit Hardik Pandya giving them the flexibility needed to play either a third seamer or a third spinner in Kuldeep Yadav.
Bangladesh's batters have rarely given them any sort of cushion.

Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto isn't quite able to work out why they're struggling with the bat
Miscellaneous Highlights: India ended their ICC trophy drought, winning their first title since 2013.
India are also deriving the joys of having a fully-fit Hardik Pandya giving them the flexibility needed to play either a third seamer or a third spinner in Kuldeep Yadav.
Others: The turnaround time from their loss on Thursday night to Australia is short, but at least they wouldn't have had to hop islands, like India, who arrived hours after convincingly beating Afghanistan in Barbados.
There's growing pressure, even if not entirely from within the team, on Shivam Dube to come good as the spin enforcer.
The passionate fans from both sides have ensured this rivalry has assumed massive significance.
Rohit Sharma has a good record against Mustafizur, with 122 runs in 72 balls in all T20s at a strike rate of 169.44, while being dismissed three times.
